intro: Nudilus, commonly known as the naked stem plant, is a unique species characterized by its lack of leaves along its central stem. This plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is native to certain regions of Africa. Its botanical structure features a thick, woody stem with modified leaves that appear as small, rounded structures at the base. Nudilus produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. The plant is adapted to arid environments, showcasing resilience through its reduced foliage and efficient water storage mechanisms.
